segments.text: Looking at the woman, I see how focused she is on that plate, like it's the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely oblivious to the chaos unfolding around her, and it's both fascinating and infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of disbelief, watching her ignore the water, the children, everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger and bigger, but she doesn't even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what's going through her mind, or if she's even aware of her surroundings at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how calm she seems, like she's in her own little world, untouched by the madness around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit of envy, wishing I could be that focused, that untroubled by distractions.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so mischievous, but she doesn't notice them, doesn't react to them at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon, before something bad happens, but I also hope she stays in her little world, safe and untouched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a sense of sadness, watching her miss out on the chaos and the joy of the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
